H0.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Territory

H1.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Mineral Rights

H2.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Waterways

H3.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Land

A4.text: The treaty gave the U.S. undisputed control of Texas, established the U.S.â€“Mexican border along the Rio Grande, and ceded to the United States the present-day states of California, Nevada, and Utah, most of New Mexico, Arizona and Colorado, and parts of Texas, Oklahoma, Kansas, and Wyoming.

A5.text: The area of domain acquired was given by the Federal Interagency Committee as 338,680,960 acres (529,189 square miles).
